high_consensus.description: Define error taxonomy for gen/validate scripts — parse error, missing file, partial scan — with non-zero exit codes and fail-closed behavior. Without minimum-field gates, gen/validate sharing same broken logic gives false confidence.
Route extraction needs to define supported Express patterns and explicit fallback behavior for unresolvable patterns (dynamic registration, conditional routes, computed strings).
Define stability semantics for 'guaranteed-stable' endpoints — versioning (path/header/semver), compatibility guarantees, deprecation windows, and promotion criteria from Tier 2 to Tier 1.
Document recognized AST patterns for extractor with examples and non-examples. Add a linter/gate that flags unrecognized route registration constructs in scanned directories.

disputed.description: Accessibility/i18n guidelines for documentation. GPT scored low (320), Opus higher (680). Not tied to current scope.

blockers.concern: No mechanism to detect behavioral drift in 70+ indexed endpoints. Smoke tests only cover 7 stable. Indexed endpoints' auth/status/response can change silently.
Route extraction via ts-morph is likely incomplete for real-world Express patterns (dynamic composition, HOFs, env-gated, computed strings). Baseline count gate can still pass with wrong routes.
Citation pinning depends on GitHub API availability, tag immutability, network access. No offline mode, no retry/backoff, no caching of already-pinned refs.
BUTTERFREEZONE extraction determinism not proven across OS/filesystem/Node/ts-morph versions. Glob order, locale, line endings can vary.
AUTH_BYPASS and dev JWKS are documentation-only safeguards with no code-level enforcement. Docs teaching shortcuts get copied to production.
